desc: This course provides practical information specifically relevant to the field of visual arts and art education. Students learn basic concepts about child growth, developmental stages, learning styles and varied classroom approaches. They participate in classroom observations and practical applications of classroom activities, prepare units of instruction and micro-teach. Topics include arts advocacy, interdisciplinary instruction, assessment and teaching art history. Required field experience component. Prerequisite: Education 330 or permission of the instructor. Spring Semester only.
name: Teaching of Art, K-12
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Education 330 or permission of the instructor. Spring Semester only.
title: Teaching of Visual Art, K-12
